entry.title: WriteUp: 0CTF 2016 warmup
entry.content:
0x0 Checksec

0x1 Reverse Enginnering

frame stack0x30; readvar_20[esp+30h+var_20][esp + 0x30 - 0x20],var_200x20, stack overflow. len0x340x20,stack overflowret address,.

0x2 Analyze

stack overflowint 0x80system calllibc.sorop chain.

int 0x80readwrite, system call
(.text:08048122 -> .text:08048134)

eaxsystem_call

  • system

    eax = 0xb, execve("/bin/sh")

  • open-read-write

    open("flag", 0); //eax = 5
    read(3, buffer, len); //eax = 3
    write(1, buffer, len); // eax = 4
    read,write

eaxalarm
alarmSIGALRMalarmalarm******

alarm10system('/bin/sh')0xb,open-read-write

0x3 Exploit Code

0x4 Output Example

0x5 The Challenge

https://buuoj.cn/challenges#warmup
entry.summary: 0x0 Checksec

entry.title: WriteUp: hitcontraining_playfmt
entry.content:
Checksec

  • a. i386 gdb.debugprocessgdb.attachexploitstart
  • b. Has RWX segments: gdb playfmtvmmapstack
  • c. No PIE: ELFELF

Reverse Engineering

Fig. 1. Vulnerability Point

(1),Format String Attack.

Analyze

read->printfwhile(True)payload

bufstackpayload

Format String AttackShell CodeRWXFormat String AttackShell Codeshell
exploit

  • a. %Mc MprintfMexploit codeio.recvuntil(b' ')b' 'printf
  • b. stackebp->prev-frame-esp->prevprev-frame-esp...ebpebpesp
    • ebpebp
    • ebp
  • c. exploit codeone_gadget,systemlibcSearcherlibc.so

Exploit Code

Output Example

The Challenge

https://buuoj.cn/challenges#hitcontraining_playfmt
entry.summary: Checksec

entry.title: AFL++ Frida-Mode: Usecases for testing and debugging
entry.content:
Fuzzing

AFL_PRELOAD=/usr/local/lib/afl/afl-frida-trace.soharness javascriptafl.js:

afl-frida-trace.soPATHAFL++ Frida_Modeafl.js

(persistentdummy inputout/default/.cur_input)

forkserver

GDB Debugging

Example 1: AFL_DEBUG_CHILD

Example 2:

Scripting

harnessjs

entry.title: AFL++ Frida-Mode Scripting
entry.content:
Scripting

FRIDAJavascriptFRIDAFRIDA

FRIDA(fuzz)afl.jsFRIDAAFL_FRIDA_JS_SCRIPT

frida apiFRIDA modeAfl Afl.print("Hello world"); console.log("Hello World");

AFL_DEBUG_CHILD=1.

Example

persistent fuzz

API
DebugSymbol.fromName().

Module.getExportByName().

Stripped binaries

Persistent hook

Persistent hook(***.so)hookfuzzLLVMFuzzerTestOneInputFrida_mode/hookPersistent Hook

Persistent HookFRIDACModuleTinyCC

Advanced persistence

fuzz

CModuleFRIDA

slowpersistent

Replacing LLVMFuzzerTestOneInput

LLVMFuzzerTestOneInputLLVMFuzzerTestOneInputMy_LLVMFuzzerTestOneInputbuflen__afl_fuzzer_ptr__afl_fuzz_lenhookin-memory fuzzingCModuleC

Hooking main

mainHookmainFRIDAhookStalkerInterceptor.replacemainJSsetJsMainHook

Library Fuzzing

FRIDAModule.loadAPI,mainFuzz

Patching

FuzzFRIDA

Advanced patching

Consider the following code fragment

FRIDAInterceptor.replaceInterceptor.attachAPIStalkerAPI

UD2nopUD2

patch

OR

OR

js_stalker_callbackTRUE,FALSENOP

forkserverforkserverbug
note that the same callback will be called when compiling instrumented
code both in the child of the forkserver (as it is executed) and also in the
parent of the forkserver (when prefetching is enabled) so that it can be
inherited by the next forked child. It is VERY important that the same
instructions be generated in both the parent and the child or if prefetching is
disabled that the same instructions are generated every time the block is
compiled. Failure to do so will likely lead to bugs which are incredibly
difficult to diagnose. The code above only prints the instructions when running
in the parent process (the one provided by Process.id when the JS script is
executed).

OSX

OSXJavaScriptapiCoreSymbolicationAPICoreFoundation

CoreSymbolicationAPIcacheafl-fuzz-t
